data.title: Asian Food Fusion
data.text: This is a fascinating place. It is romantically lit with the most inviting menu I have experienced in an Asian restaurant. At first, the server was a little short, but as time went on, he warned up and his personality was fabulous. You can't go wrong with whatever you order and there are so many options for whatever your meat or non meat preference is. My food was amazing and delicious. The Egg rolls weren't quite as flavorful as I would prefer, so next time I will order the spinach wontons.

data.title: Ok if you're staying downtown, or with a group
data.text:
Five years ago, I said this was my favorite place for Thai food.  Since that time, a small Hmong diner opened, serving Southeast Asian foods, called Plia's Kitchen. 

Plia's is mostly carry-out, having only enough seating for about 20 people, but OMG, I never knew what real Thai food tasted like!  Bangkok is Americanized by comparison - their Pad Thai, which used to be my "comfort food" - was a disappointment to me after having Plia's.

If you don't know much about Thai food, are just in town visiting and looking for something close to your hotel OR you are dining with a group, I think you will find the food here to be Ok to very good.  

But if you want fantastic, and are willing to search it out, go to Plia's kitchen.

data.title: A Welcome Change
data.text: It's nice to have a dependable restaurant to go to, but in this case - it was a delightful discovery and welcome change to the typical menu.  Great old character to the location.  Seated all 7 of us at a roomy table.  I don't remember the names of the entrees, but the coconut based soup was delicious as were all our dishes.  You may adjust the "heat" of each dish as you like.  Even the 6 and 9-year-old found a dish to share.  New waitress was friendly and efficient.

data.title: Amazed at a new food experienced
data.text: A friend of mine who enjoys Thai food tells me "lets go here you will like it".  I explained to the wait staff that I have never had Thai food before so I wanted to order something safe but still be able to say that I tried something new.  I got the volcano chicken, and it was very good.  I can say that I had a great experience at this restaurant,  The staff is friendly, the food is great, the building itself has a great old feeling about itself.  For me this is one of my faves when I come to Green Bay

data.title: Great Thai..needs Attention to detail
data.text: Was in GB on business and really wanted some good Thai food. Wisconsin is not known for any cuisine other than beer and brats, but this was very good. Unfortunately I got it as take out and when I arrived at my hotel I discovered they gave me food, but no utensils, napkins or a straw. I would have given it a 5 if they had remembered these.

data.title: Great seafood soup with coconut milk
data.text: We had seafood soups with coconut milk and beef and seafood salads . Everything was good . The service was also great . Very nice location in the downtown of Green Bay.

data.title: Good food, a bit pricey
data.text: We enjoying eating inside, as it's always a peaceful experience. Good food and plenty of options to choose from, including some vegan ones.  Tasty drinks, too.

data.title: Great food
data.text: It was late in the day, we were extremely tired after touring the UWGB campus with our whole family.  Didn't want fast food, but, wanted food fast.  We called a nephew who had gone to school in green bay, and he recommended this restaurant.  He had eaten their lunch Buffett often when he was in school, and being Vietnamese, he said the food was very good and authentic.  We were so glad to find that to be true.  We were all well satisfied.  The atmosphere was very quiet, and we were able to get cocktails for the adults.  Something we found to be very much appreciated.  We will undoubtedly be going back when we travel back to Green Bay.

data.title: One of my favorite Thai Restaurants
data.text: I love their lunch buffet.  It's small and has a limited number of options but I always go and eat more than I should.  Green and red curry, pad thai, noodles, rice, chicken, pork, beef dishes, spring rolls, and soup.  That's plenty for me.  I also always order a Thai Iced Tea.  I think it's delicious.  I hardly ever go here just to order food.  I have, and it's pretty good.  I think some of the other Thai restaurants have better dinner food, but for lunch, this is the SPOT.

data.title: Worth a Revisit
data.text: I went here a number of times over the years, always disappointed. This time I actually got something they are known for the volcano chicken, it gave me some faith in the place despite a number of lack luster experiences. The menu is probably too big to offer quality food, but if you stick to what they do best you will be happy...if not don't blame me. Also the servers seem to be over stretched, but it's not their fault seems like they are in the process of hiring more.

data.title: Slop, pure and simple, TERRIBLE
data.text:
So, to quantify my comment let me say I lived and worked in Thailand for a couple years to include visiting for over 30, so I say again, this was slop, an insult to Thai food which is distinctive in flavor and fresh.

I ordered red curry. After waiting 20 minutes it finally came out, ON A PLATE. I asked the waitress, " on a plate?!" She said she wished they'd put it in a bowl but......I tasted it and it was cold, more importantly it had a bitter taste to it. Not what you would expect to taste like a creamy coco nutty sweet flavor as Thai curry should be. On the plate was a small scoop of rice, also cool. Are you kidding me? This was for 8.95$ This is a dish that can be made for under 3$ with all the ingredients and they want to be cheap on the ingredients, consequently it being terrible. Who serves curry on a plate!?

Don't waste your time at this place. The ended up taking it off my bill because I pushed it aside and refused, actually couldn't, eat the dish. It was just terrible. I can't remember ever rating one as bad as this, but it is deserved.

data.title: Definitely worth it!
data.text: We were walking by this restaurant and decided to give it a try. We were impressed with the good food and great service. Our waitress was so friendly and the food was delicious!

data.title: Over priced Over cooked Over rated
data.text: The service was prompt enough but the food tasted like it came from a buffet. I will not go back and I suggest you avoid as there are better choices in Green Bay. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy as well.

data.title: Disappointing Lunch Buffet
data.text:
While the staff was friendly the lunch buffet did not live up to my expectations. The food was mediocre at best and most items on the buffet were cold.

Maybe ordering from the menu would have been better. However, I think a lunch buffet should represent the overall quality of the food coming from the kitchen.

Unfortunately, this would not be my first choice for Thai in downtown Green Bay.

data.title: Good food, drab location
data.text:
This is not your typical Thai restaurant.  The food is good and the wait staff was very friendly.  The food portions are quit large which is great if you want to get two meals out of your dinner.  They can put tofu in anything, even though the menu leave it out as an option for many of the dishes.  

What I didn't care much for was the decor.  It looks like a TGIFriday type place that hasn't been updated in 25 years.  Very dark. Furniture is old and worn out.  However, the foods quality make up for the physical appearance.

data.title: Great Service, Good food
data.text: Went to dinner with my family of 5. Ordered a wide assortment of food including two Curries, Spicy seafood, Pad Thai and Pho. All were very tasty but a bit pricey we thought. The shrimp rolls had very little shrimp and tasteless sauce. Server (Maggie)  was very helpful and offered us a different sauce when we did not like the shrimp roll sauce, but we had eaten them since we were hungry with just the chill sauce from the table assortment. Would go back, but would go more often if prices were in line with most area Chinese restaurants since the ingredients are not that different. They  also sholud deep clean that place and wash the windows which were yucky!

data.title: Best Thai in town!
data.text: GREEN Curry! You must get it!  Never have had a bad dish there, all are so yummy.  They can make most items vegetarian on request. Lemongrass soup is amazing. Veggie egg rolls are a must. Nice, quiet atmosphere. No crazy rush.  Sit back and enjoy one of their tasty tropical drinks while you enjoy all the smells and tastes they have to offer.

data.title: Favorite Thai Restaurant!!
data.text: Love Love Love this restaurant. My fiancé orders something different every time we go and always loves it. He has a VERY high tolerance for spicy foods and they can always accommodate that! I, on the other hand, cannot tolerate any spice and they are always on top of that as well. The staff is always friendly and fast. Cannot say anything bad about this place. It's usually close to empty, which makes me sad because I feel they offer such amazing food.

data.title: Authentic experience
data.text: Great place.. Great food and service.. A bit tough deciding on menu selection,, but you can rest assured you will enjoy.

data.title: it's ok
data.text:
The food was ok. I had the Tom Kha Gai soup which was overpowered by large slices of onion and tomato chunks that did not add to the flavor.  The lemon grass and ginger and lime were muted. My guest's chicken curry soup tasted salty and fishy. My sticky rice was hard and dry. More like a ball of dried glue than sticky rice.

The service was slow. Took 5+ min to be seated, even though I was the only one waiting. Took more than 5 min to get a menu.  Another 7 min for my guest to get chopsticks. There was 1 staff person on duty doing orders and filling the buffet....which did not look so very good. Others in the restaurant seemed to enjoy the buffe.t.
